questions.text: A 22year old female comes to Gynaecology OPD. She is physiologically and anatomically Female but she wanted to be a male mentally. She came to know about sexual transformation surgery is possible with homologous organs and asks you about the homologous vaginal parts of male counterparts. Which of the homologous parts are true except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Gartner's duct --- bulbourethral glands Homologous structures in male and female genitalia are

questions.text: Exposure of a female fetus to androgen in early embryogenesis may arrest differentiation of:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Urogenital sinus In females exposure of androgens in early embryogenesis results in ambiguous external genitalia. The external genitalia is formed by the urogenital sinus.

Extraedge:

The most common cause of ambiguous genitalia in a female fetus is androgen insensitivity syndrome. The most common cause of ambiguous genitalia in a male fetus is congenital adrenal hyperplasia.

questions.text: Destruction of ovaries prior to the 7th week following fertilization results in:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

None of the above In females: If ovaries are destructed prior to 7 weeks then it will lead to a decrease in estrogen so secondary sexual characteristics in females will not develop, and she will complain of amenorrhea. The uterus develops from a Mullerian duct, hence the uterus will be present but underdeveloped (infantile) due to lack of estrogen. Pseudohermaphroditism in females means Gonads are ovaries but external genitalia is male. The external genitalia of males is due to exposure to androgens in females at early stages of development, and not because of the absence of ovaries.

Highyeild:

differentiation of gonads is by sry gene presence of amh regression of mullerian duct and absence of uterus differentiation of external genitalia is by dihydrotestosterone

questions.text: The vaginal epithelium is derived from:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Endoderm of urogenital sinus The vagina is developed mainly from the Müllerian ducts and partly from the urogenital sinus. The upper two-thirds develop from the fused uterovaginal canal of the Müllerian ducts. The mucous membrane is developed from the endoderm of the canalized (vaginal plate) sino vaginal bulbs(urogenital sinus). The musculature is developed from the mesoderm of the fused caudal vertical part of the Müllerian ducts. The hymen is developed from the junction of the Müllerian tubercle (mesodermal) and the urogenital sinus (endodermal). The lower one-third is developed entirely from the endoderm of the urogenital sinus. Vaginal introitus is developed from the ectoderm of the genital folds after the rupture of the bilaminar urogenital membrane.

Highyeild:
